originalText.plaidHtml: This movie shows reality of Pakistan. This year's standout film is a rare cinematic achievement that balances emotional depth, technical brilliance, and powerful storytelling with remarkable confidence. From its opening frame to its unforgettable final moments, the movie holds the audience in a firm grip, never losing momentum or purpose. It is not just entertaining-it is meaningful, memorable, and deeply human.

Story: The way it blends real-life history (like the Lyari gang wars and intelligence ops) with high-stakes drama is incredible. It feels grounded yet massive in scale.

Music: Shashwat Sachdev has outdone himself. The way the soundtrack integrates with the tension-especially the use of those classic ghazals and high-energy tracks-makes the 214-minute runtime fly by.

Action: Unlike the usual "gravity-defying" stunts, the action here feels raw and realistic. The car chases and the tension in the Karachi sequences are world-class.

Performances: Ranveer Singh's restrained performance as Hamza is a career-best, and Akshaye Khanna as Rehman Dakait is absolutely terrifying.

The Verdict: "Jordar Movie Che!" It's not just a spy thriller; it's a landmark for Indian Cinema. If you haven't seen it yet, you are missing out on a masterpiece.

This film satiates a forever thirst for an actual spy movie without the unnecessary love angles between the different spies and how they ave to dance everytime to move the plot forward or not. The violence and gore that some refer to as "too much testosterone" is an absolute necessity since many of the brutal killings happened in real life and it is important to reflect on the suffering of people and learn from history. Itching to watch it again in a cinema soon.

It's an addiction . Even after 24 hours it is in my mind for shear fine execution of story with well supported BGM and superb casting and acting .

Shashwat Sachdev has done a great job with BGM and superb numbers with some new comers.

Use of retro songs gives another touch to visuals Cinematography is at other level .

Editing is done so well it keeps you seated despite long run.

It is not easy to get off its after effects .

Please go and enjoy it.

summary.originalText: One of the Best Bollywood movie!!

originalText.plaidHtml:
Usually, Bollywood is known for it's B grade movies, showcasing abs, six packs, cleavages, boring dances.

Dhurandar is made with top notch screenplay, music and a gripping storyline. Though the spying skills are shown at beginner level ( compared to Israel movies), working as a spy in a radicalised society, should have more than two balls.

Movie realistic Locations - 10/10 Music - 10/10 Screenplay and direction - 10/10 Story - 10/10 Cast - 9/10

Dedicated to all the innocent lives lost as a result of one ideology.

Super experience.... Gr8 direction, phenomenal performances, indepth analysis and impactful screen play.... all departments at their best... apt music, amazing camera work.. beautiful locations wisely used to picturise the film... very close to reality and pacy screnplay, we have to watch in theaters only..

summary.originalText: A big praise to casting director.

originalText.plaidHtml: I mean thats how a action movie should be made.although the romance was a bit over forced.it looked like a fill up other than that best thing about the movie was it keeps you connected.the characters were made exactly as they were in reality .a bit over glamorized the character of rehman dakait but other than that great presence.arjun rampal my god this guy just looks so real.i think if they will show more of him in another part of the movie which may come out that will show the talent which he possesses.ranveer great energy but but but akshay khanna from section 370 to dhurandar what versatility this guy has .

summary.originalText: Not a movie it's an emotion

originalText.plaidHtml: Must watch for every Indian. What a movie... Aditya dhar was successful to extract 100 percent performance from every actor. Three and half hour felt very less I could watch for next 3 hour. The pacing of the movie is good it's the content. Aditya dhar was phenomenal in covering all that content with real live photo and videos.

It was worth the wait and worth watch from URI to now Dhurandar what an amazing work. And what a star cast. All the amazing in one. It has to be epic. Love the acting of Akshay Khana after such a long time and ranverr singh as well. Could go to watch it again. Waiting for the second part now.

Finally, a Bollywood action film that doesn't bend over backwards to appease the perpetually offended brigade. Dhurandhar is raw, loud, patriotic, and gloriously politically incorrect in the best way possible. The hero doesn't waste time delivering lectures on secularism or climate change while terrorists are blowing things up, he just gets the job done with bullets, punches, and zero apologies.

Perfect for anyone with a functioning brain and a spine.

Avoid if you get triggered by the Indian flag.

Highly recommended for sane audiences. Left-liberals, kindly skip, your blood pressure will thank you.

Dhurandar is a powerful and intense movie but it feels truly impactful only if you already have some knowledge of Indian history and the historical background behind the story If viewers are familiar with the real historical incidents and the characters portrayed in the film the movie becomes much more engaging and meaningful
One of the strongest highlights of the movie is the makeup department The makeup artist has done an outstanding job every character looks convincing detailed and perfectly suited to their role The makeup adds realism and depth to the characters and honestly everyone looks impressive because of the excellent makeup work.

Each and every person's performance is excellent, be it in front of the camera or behind the camera.

All the goosebumps moments are commendable, strong performances, each and every actor justified their roles.

Ranveer singh is excellent as always, Akshaye Khanna is the real crowd puller. It is a must watch.

summary.originalText: Akshaye Khanna Steals the Show in This Gripping Thriller

originalText.plaidHtml:
Honestly, I went into Dhurandhar without huge expectations, but I walked out completely blown away - mainly because of Akshaye Khanna.

He is on another level in this film. There's no loud drama, no over-the-top shouting - just pure, controlled, razor-sharp acting. The way he uses his eyes, his pauses, that calm but dangerous energy... he makes every scene feel tense even when he's just standing quietly in the frame. Whenever he comes on screen, the whole film suddenly feels more serious and important.

The movie itself is gripping - dark, pacy, and engaging from start to finish. The plot has enough twists to keep you hooked, the action scenes are well done, and the world of politics, crime, and power games feels very real. The background score and visuals add a lot to the mood, too.

But for me, this is Akshaye Khanna's film.

He doesn't just play the character, he owns it. It's the kind of performance that reminds you how underrated he actually is and makes you want to see him in many more lead roles.

If you're a fan of strong acting and intense thrillers, Dhurandhar is a definite must-watch. 10/10, especially for Akshaye Khanna's brilliant performance.

summary.originalText: Love the reality shows in movie

originalText.plaidHtml:
Dhurandhar is a well-made entertainer that keeps you engaged from start to finish. The story is tight, the pacing is smooth, and every character adds something meaningful to the film. The performances are sincere and give the story real depth. The direction is sharp and the humor lands naturally without feeling forced. The emotional moments also work well and leave a lasting impression.

Overall, Dhurandhar is a refreshing film that delivers solid entertainment with a good message. It's definitely worth watching.

Instead of yrf movies where isi and raw doing romance which is fake and not related to any reality, dhurandhar shows you reality check. Such movies must be promoted instead of pathaan, ek tha tiger, and other spy yrf films.

Reality is often mostly praised than other cheap bollywood movie. Atlast dhurandhar had shown the comeback for realistic movie.

Thanks to dhurandhar and team to bring such movie.

summary.originalText: A First Theatre Experience I'll Never Forget

originalText.plaidHtml: Dhurandhar will always be special to me because it was the first movie I ever watched in a theatre, and that too on the first day, first show, and it honestly couldn't have been a better choice. The film pulls you in quietly and keeps tightening its grip through strong writing and a steadily building screenplay that never feels rushed. Ranveer Singh completely disappears into his role, bringing intensity, vulnerability, and moral conflict in a way that feels very real. Aditya Dhar's direction is confident and grounded, balancing action with reflective moments that add depth instead of just spectacle. Performances by Akshaye Khanna, Sanjay Dutt, Arjun Rampal, R. Madhavan, Sara Arjun, and Manav Gohil add weight and realism, making the world of crime, politics, and espionage feel lived-in. The cinematography and sound design enhance the tension without overpowering it, and the layered storytelling keeps you engaged till the very end. Watching this unfold on the big screen for the first time made the experience intense, emotional, and unforgettable, and it's a film that genuinely stays with you long after it ends.

Dhurandhar is a film that commands attention from its very first frame and holds it firmly till the end. Despite its long runtime of nearly 3 hours and 30 minutes, the movie never once feels exhausting - a rare achievement in itself. The narration flows with confidence, making the audience completely surrender to its world.

The music is beautifully integrated into the storytelling. The songs arrive naturally, enhancing emotions rather than interrupting the pace. The background score is one of the film's strongest assets - intense, haunting, and powerful - it amplifies every dramatic moment and elevates the film to a grand cinematic experience.

What truly sets Dhurandhar apart is its stellar casting. Ranveer Singh dominates the screen with a performance full of intensity and raw energy. Sanjay Dutt brings gravitas and authority, making his presence felt in every scene. Akshaye Khanna impresses with his restrained and layered acting, while R. Madhavan adds emotional depth and balance to the narrative. Each actor fits their role perfectly, making the characters feel lived-in and real.

Visually, the film is striking. Strong cinematography, detailed frames, and sharp editing ensure that the pace never dips. The screenplay is tightly woven, keeping the tension alive throughout and making the lengthy runtime feel surprisingly crisp.

Final Verdict: Dhurandhar is not just a film, but an experience - powerful performances, stirring music, and confident storytelling come together to deliver a gripping cinematic journey that never feels long. A must-watch for those who enjoy grand, intense cinema.

summary.originalText: An Ensemble-Driven Thriller Where Every Character Matters

originalText.plaidHtml:
This is a long film, but once it starts, you're completely pulled in and genuinely don't realise how time flies. I watched it on a large screen in Brisbane, and the 7:50 pm show was a full house, which is quite rare here, that alone says a lot.

The director deserves massive credit for giving every character equal importance. Not a single role felt like a supporting one; each character had a crucial part to play, and the actors delivered accordingly.

One of the most impressive aspects was the casting. Actors who are mostly known for comedy were given serious, intense roles, and it worked brilliantly. Dhar truly saw the untapped potential in Gaurav Gera and Rakesh Bedi, and it was refreshing and powerful to watch them in such a new light.

Akshaye Khanna, R. Madhavan, and Arjun Rampal were solid as always, they never disappoint. Ranveer Singh once again proved that he's an exceptional actor who just needs the right director to bring out his best. He should definitely do more films like this. Sanjay Dutt also did a great job.

That said, the real star of the film is the director and the story writer, who brought together such an engaging vision and gripping narrative. There were multiple nail-biting, edge-of-the-seat moments throughout the film.

I genuinely cannot wait for 26th March 2026 to watch Part 2.

Just loved the writing and direction of the movie by Aditya Dhar sir, apart from that performances by each actors Ranveer Singh, Akshay Khanna, Arjun Rampal, R Madhav Sanjay Dutt & Rajat Bedi is so incredible and goat level that will push you to rewatch it again in Theatre. Theatre experience just hit you on spot.

Damn, Hat's off to ADITYA DHAR SIR
IDK Why people's love's Akshaye Sir Character
I Love RANVEER SINGH'S HAMZA
Always Respect Our Intelligence Officer's likes Soldier
Don't Blame Them
Cause, Unko Sirf Ek Baar Jitna Hota Hai Aur Hume Har Ek Baar
Aur Ye Naya Hindustan Hai Ghar Me Ghus Ke Marega..
All Movie Is Top Notch All Elements Specially Sashwat Sachdeva's Music...

Dhurandhar isn't just a movie - it's a mirror. The film hits hard because it doesn't sugarcoat anything. It shows the world exactly as it is: the politics, the hidden motives, the moral grey areas, and how good people get crushed when they're not smart enough to navigate the system.

The storytelling is tight, the performances are brutally honest, and the message is loud without being preachy. What makes the movie stand out is that nothing feels exaggerated for drama - these are the kind of situations people actually face but never talk about openly.

If someone wants entertainment with truth, this is it. Dhurandhar is a reminder that the world is not as simple or fair as we like to pretend. It's absolutely worth watching.

Must watch for action lovers
Everyone from the cast has been absolutely phenomenal especially Ranveer as hamza and Akshaye khanna as rehman no useless cameos no useless vulgarity just pure cinema and I think we would fail as audience if this film doesn't cross 1000 cr box office collection
I would highly recommend this.

summary.originalText: When Talent, Tension, and Thrill Align

originalText.plaidHtml: The supporting actors bring depth and authenticity, making the ensemble feel like a real, living ecosystem rather than a scripted cast. The director's storytelling is patient and deliberate, allowing scenes to breathe and tension to build naturally. Even the antagonists are given room to develop, making the conflict multifaceted and emotionally engaging.
